input: Grease pie plate (10 x 1 1/2-inch)., Cook meat., Salt and pepper., Spread in pie plate., Sprinkle with cheese., Beat remaining ingredients until smooth., Pour into pie plate., Bake 25 minutes., Top with tomatoes and cheese., Bake until knife comes out clean, approximately 5 to 8 minutes more., Cool 5 minutes. Bake at 400°., Serves 6 to 8.
target: ground beef, onion, salt, pepper, Cheddar cheese, milk, Bisquick baking mix

input: Sprinkle fish with salt and pepper., Lightly dust with flour. Shake off excess., Place in single layer in lightly greased shallow casserole., Cover completely with sauce., Bake in preheated oven at 400° for 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with forks., Garnish with chives., Makes 4 servings.
target: red snapper, salt, flour, sour cream, chives

input: Heat oil in pressure cooker. Prick skin of sausages in several places with a fork. Add the sausages and chicken to the oil and cook until well browned on all sides.
target: olive oil, Italian link sausages, chicken, onion, green bell peppers, garlic, red wine vinegar, tomatoes, basil, fennel seeds, red pepper, Salt

input: Butter a one-quart casserole., Layer 1/3 turnips, top with 1/3 onion, sprinkle with 2 teaspoons flour and 1/3 teaspoon salt, pepper and 1 tablespoon butter., Repeat this layering twice. Combine milk and cream and pour over turnips., Cover and bake at 350° for 30 minutes., Remove cover and bake for another 30 to 45 minutes or until tender and bubbly.
target: butter, onions, flour, salt, pepper, milk, light cream

input: Place all ingredients in a blender and process until smooth.
target: Kelloggs, Banana

input: Dissolve jello in boiling water., Mix in cranberry sauce. Then add cold water., Chill until slightly thickened., Fold in walnuts and drained pineapple., Chill until firm., Serves 6 to 8.
target: cherry jello, boiling water, walnuts, pineapple, cranberry sauce, cold water

input: Bring wine to boil in large heavy saucepan on high heat., Reduce heat to medium., Gradually add cheese, about 1/4 cup at a time, stirring constantly; cook until cheese is partially melted and forms a ball in centre of pan., Stir in cornstarch; continue to cook until cheese is completely melted and mixture is well blended and comes to boil., Serve in fondue pot set over low heat.
target: white wine, Swiss cheese, corn starch

input: combine first 3 ingredients in a small sauce pan and heat until sugar disolves, , in a separate bowl combine next 5 ingredints, , pat fish dry season with S&P, place fish in a large piece foil pour all ingredients over fish fold foil around fish, crimp edges bake 14- 18 min in a 400 degree over.
target: rice vinegar, T sugar, red pepper, cilantro, fish sauce, coconut milk, T, garlic, red snapper

input: Combine ingredients with whisk., Crush Wasa crackers and sprinkle on top., Bake for 30 minutes at 350°.
target: yellow squash, Egg Beaters, onion, butter, diet sweetener, salt

input: Combine all ingredients in bowl; mix well., Refrigerate until serving time., Serve on lettuce.
target: pecans, pineapple, mandarin oranges, coconut, marshmallows, cottage cheese, cream cheese

input: Combine the water, lime juice, tequila, and cointreau in a half-gallon pitcher. Stir to mix., To serve, rub the rim of a margarita glass with lime, and dip in salt. Fill the glass with ice, and top with the tequila mixture. Garnish with a slice of lime.
target: water, lime juice, cointreau, silver tequila, lime, salt

input: Preheat your oven to 375., Prepare ravioli and spinach., Grease 8"x8" baking dish and spoon enough marinara in to coat the bottom., Put a layer of the ravioli and top with more sauce., Sprinkle spinach and mozzarella then top with ravioli and then more marinara, repeat layers until your dish is full., Don't overdo it or it will boil over., Top off with Parmesan cheese and remaining mozzarella., Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes Then Remove foil and bake another 10 mins or until the cheese on top is slightly browning and bubbly., Let cool for 10 mins before serving., you can use meat ravioli as well, or even add cooked ground beef to your marinara for meat lovers!
target: marinara sauce, cheese ravioli, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese

input: Brown Smoked Sausge (you can use any type you prefer i.e., pork sausage)., Mix first five ingredients., Fold in cheese (you can yse any type you prefer i.e., cheddar, monterey)., Fold in cooled sausage., Grease baking dish ( I use 9x12)., Spread the batter in the dish., Bake at 350 degrees until browned (about 45 min).
target: baking mix, mix, milk, eggs, oil, cheese, sausage

input: Place roast into a crock pot and pour Lipton Onion Soup Mix and Cream of Mushroom Soup over the roast., Cook on low for 6-8 hours., Turn crock pot on high and add remaining ingredients., Cook until vegetables are heated through., Optional: May be served over rice
target: beef roast, Onion Soup Mix, Cream of Mushroom Soup, english peas, corn, baby carrots, Rice

input: Preheat oven to 350 F., In a large skillet, heat 1 tbsp. olive oil and saute carrots, shallots and fennel., Add pink peppercorns, 3 teaspoons violet jam and salt. Stir., Cook until tender but still crunchy., Meanwhile, place fish on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper., Drizzle with olive oil, and season with salt and pepper., Bake for about 25 minutes until cooked through., Serve fish on top with sauteed vegetables and garnish with remaining violet jam.
target: carrot, shallot, fennel, olive oil, peppercorns, salt

input: Special equipment: 30 wood skewers, soaked in water, On a hot grill, sear the scallops until edges start to caramelize., Wrap each scallop in a strip of bacon and secure with skewer., Return to grill until bacon is cooked and inside of scallop is opaque., Serve with your choice of dipping sauce.
target: bacon

input: Place all ingredients but cranberries in bread machine pan, Set bread machine to basic setting, After 35 minutes open and add the cranberries and cinnamon, Bread will be done in 3 hours (total), Let it cool, slice into 20, and enjoy!
target: eggs, milk, water, sugar, flour, salt, butter, yeast, ground cinnamon, cranberries, cranberries

input: Combine egg and water and then add remaining ingredients., Bake for 1 hour at 250°., Stir first 1/2 hour., Use 1 1/2 to 2 pounds pecan halves.
target: egg, water, sugar, cinnamon, salt

input: Mix burger, basil, salt, pepper and onion together; shape into patties., Brown in 1 teaspoon oleo or oil., Saute mushrooms in 2 tablespoons oleo., Add to brown gravy mix and 1/2 cup water., Mix well., Add patties to this mixture and simmer 20 minutes.
target: burger, basil, salt, pepper, onion, mushrooms, oleo, brown gravy mix, water

input: Whip up and refrigerate., Make ice cream with clean snow fall.
target: eggs, milk, sugar, vanilla

input: Boil rotini noodles until tender., Rinse with cold water and drain noodles., In large bowl, mix vegetables, cut up into small pieces., Add vinegar and oil., Add Salad Supreme and noodles., Mix well and refrigerate until cold.
target: white vinegar, vegetable oil, Salad Supreme, onions, tomatoes, green peppers, rotini noodles

input: Mix ingredients in bowl whisking in olive oil last -- very slowly., Marinate 24 hours.
target: olive oil, soy sauce, balsamic vinegar, garlic, rosemary

input: Preheat oven to 325 degrees., Put the oil in the bottom of a large roasting pan., Place the veal in the pan with the garlic and cover with tin foil., Roast the veal for one hour, basting frequently., Peel the potatoes and cut them into one-and-a-half-inch pieces., Cover with water and set aside., Dry the potatoes with paper towels and after the veal has roasted for one hour, place them in the roasting pan around the veal., Sprinkle with rosemary and roast for one hour., The veal will have cooked two hours in all., Remove the veal to a heated serving dish and surround with potatoes., Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste., Pour the fat from the roasting pan and add the stock and wine., Bring to boil., Simmer for a couple of minutes until the sauce has thickened slightly., Correct seasoning and serve in a heated sauceboat.
target: vegetable oil, loin, garlic, potatoes, rosemary, salt, veal, red wine

input: Cook pasta according to package directions, omitting salt and fat., In a large bowl, combine pasta and remaining ingredients. Toss well.
target: pasta, halved grape tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, olives, fresh basil, red wine vinegar, extra-virgin olive oil, garlic, salt, red pepper

input: Insert a wooden stick into each hot dogs. Put 3 T flour on a plate and roll hot dogs in flour to coat, shaking off excess., Heat 3 inches oil to 350 degrees F in a deep pot over medium high heat., Whisk together cornmeal, 1/2 C flour, 2 T oil, baking powder, sugar, baking soda, cayenne, and salt in a medium bowl. Add eggs 1 at a time, whisking well after each addition. Whisk in buttermilk., Transfer some of batter to a tall glass, filling it almost to the top., Working in batches of 2 or 3, dip hot dogs 1 at a time into glass of batter to coat. Add more batter to glass if necessary. Fry, turning occasionally until golden brown all over, about 2-3 minutes., Transfer corn dogs to paper towels to drain. Repeat until all hot dogs are done., You may have leftover batter, use the batter to dip veggies such as asparagus, green beans, onions and fry for 1-2 minutes until batter is used up. Or you can open another package of hotdogs and fry 4-5 more.
target: flour, flour, cornmeal, baking powder, sugar, vegetable oil, salt, baking soda, cayenne, eggs, buttermilk, oil

input: Mix all ingredients well and spread into 9 x 13-inch glass baking pan., Bake at 350° for 15 minutes., Let cool; cut into 2 x 2-inch bars.
target: butter, eggs, honey, vanilla, sugar, flour, baking powder, pecans

input: You also need a mortar & pestle., Put equal amounts of saffron & white sugar in your mortar. Grind together using the pestle., Boil some water. (A Turkish coffee maker pot works well as it holds a small amount)., Add some of the hot water to the saffron mixture (1 tbs to about 1/8- 1/4 tsp Iranian saffron) and pour into a spice bottle. Cover & give it a nice shake., Open the lid and let it cool down to room temperature., Store bottle in the fridge and use as needed.
target: iranian saffron, white sugar, water

input: Mix ingredients together and bake for 1 hour at 350°.
target: hamburger, salt, onion, tomatoes, rice, pepper, butter

input: Measure flour, salt, and baking powder into a large bowl. Stir to mix. Pour melted butter and water over flour mixture. Stir with fork to make a ball., Turn dough out on a lightly floured surface, and knead gently about 10 times. Pat into a flat circle 3/4 to 1 inch thick., Cook in a greased frying pan over medium heat, allowing about 15 minutes for each side. Use two lifters for easy turning. May also be baked on a greased baking sheet at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 25 to 30 minutes.
target: all-purpose, salt, baking powder, butter, water

input: In separate batches, pulse the chuck and the sirloin in a food processor 10 times., Combine the chuck, sirloin, and kosher salt in a large bowl., Form the meat into 5-ounce patties., Heat a cast iron skillet or griddle over medium-high heat for 2 to 3 minutes., Place the hamburger patties in the pan., For medium-rare burgers, cook the patties for 4 minutes on each side., For medium burgers, cook the patties for 5 minutes on each side., Flip the burgers only once during cooking.
target: chuck, sirloin, kosher salt

input: Roll out sheet to 1/8-inch thick., Brush sheet with mustard; top with ham, cheese and top with remaining sheet., Fold ends together and with a fork, press sides., Brush egg yolk on top. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes on cookie sheet.
target: deli, pastry sheets, mustard, Mozzarella, egg

input: Preheat oven to low broil. Place a rack in the center of the oven., In a small bowl mix all ingredients (except bread) together till well blended., Split bread into halves and spread on each half on a foil-lined baking pan or cookie sheet., Place on the center rack of the oven. Put the bread in the preheated oven for 5- 8 minutes or until bread has desired brownness.
target: Butter, Garlic, ¼, ¼, ¼, ¼, ¼, Parsley, Italian

input: Combine ingredients well., Roll into balls and place on ungreased cookie sheet., Bake 15 minutes at 350°., Roll in powdered sugar while still warm.
target: butter, sugar, ground almonds, flour, vanilla, salt

input: Mix the meat with all the above ingredients except the thyme in a., large pot to coat. Ensure the meat is thoroughly mixed and covered., Place the mixture in the crock pot, add the snipped thyme., Cook on high 1 hour, reduce to low and cook for 5-6 hours or until tender and juices run clear.
target: chicken, chicken, onions, garlic, ginger, thyme, garlic, salt, black pepper, curry powder, lemon pepper, scotch

input: Beat egg white until stiff. Stir in lemon juice, salt and sugar. Sprinkle 2 tablespoons sugar over waxed paper. Pour mixture onto this. Roll it out about 1 inch thick. Spread peanut butter on top of this. Roll up like a jelly roll., Place in refrigerator until ready to slice.
target: egg, lemon juice, salt, sugar

input: Sift flour, then mix it with the farina, baking soda and baking powder., Cream butter until very light, andd vanilla, and beat again. Beat egg yolks in bowl with the sugar until very thick. Add to the butter, beating in thoroughly. Beat the whites in another bowl until stiff, then fold them alternately and gently, with the flour, into the butter mixture. Pour into a buttered pan and spread evenly. Bake in preheated 350 F. oven for 45 min., In the meantime, boil the suagr and water together in a saucepan for 5 min. Remove the froth. Pour the hot syrup very slowly and evenly over the hot cake. Cool and serve.
target: flour, farina Cream, baking soda, baking powder, butter, vanilla, eggs, sugar, sugar, water

input: Place the cream and butter in a saucepan and heat over medium heat., Once all the butter is melted, add the Parmesan cheese., Stir the cheese., in with a whisk until it is well incorporated., Bring to a simmer and cook over medium-low heat for 5 minutes., Add in the vinegar, salt, pepper, and nutmeg (if desired)., Stir well., Taste, and add more salt and pepper if desired.
target: heavy cream, butter, parmesan cheese, white wine vinegar, salt, pepper, nutmeg

input: Measure all ingredients into a large ziploc bag, shake well., To use: add 2-3 T. per 2lbs of Meat.
target: flour, oregano, basil, salt, black pepper, garlic, paprika, cayenne pepper, celery seeds, onion powder, rosemary

input: Spread bread with dressing; sprinkle with chili powder., Top with remaining ingredients., Broil 5 min., or until cheese is melted.
target: bread, chili powder, Honey, black olives, green chiles, Milk

input: Mix well., Fold in a 2 pound bag frozen hash browns., Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
target: butter, cream of celery soup, salt, pepper, onion, sour cream, Cheddar cheese

input: Sift dry ingredients into a 13 x 9-inch pan., Make 3 holes in dry ingredients., Put vanilla in first hole, vinegar in second hole and oil in the third hole., Pour water over all ingredients. Mix with fork., Bake at 350° for 40 to 45 minutes., Let cool in pan., Frost with favorite icing.
target: flour, sugar, salt, cocoa, baking soda, vanilla, oil, vinegar, water

input: Mix all thoroughly; form into walnut size balls., Bake on ungreased sheet at 350° for 15 to 18 minutes., Serve immediately or store and serve as follows:, cool sausage balls., Place in freezer bags and freeze., Do not thaw., Place on ungreased baking sheets and bake at 325° for 5 to 8 minutes., Serve immediately., Do not microwave., Makes 3 dozen.
target: Bisquick, Cheddar cheese, pork sausage

input: Combine vegetables in a large bowl; set aside., Combine remaining ingredients in saucepan; bring to a boil., Boil 1 minute., Pour over vegetables., Cover and chill 8 hours., Serve with a slotted spoon.
target: tomatoes, onion, green pepper, cucumber, cider vinegar, water, sugar, salt, red pepper, black pepper, celery salt

input: In a large saucepan, bring the vegetable broth or water to a boil with the chili powder., Stirring constantly, add the polenta., Reduce the heat to a simmer., Simmer for 45 minutes, stirring frequently, until the polenta is creamy and very thick., It should coat a wooden spoon thickly when it is done., Remove pan from heat., Spoon the polenta into a greased 24-count mini muffin tin., Make sure you press the polenta firmly into the pan so that the bites dont crumble when you remove them., You know how cornmeal gets., Press your thumb or a spoon into the center of each muffin bite to make a shallow dent., Chill at least an hour, or up to 1 week., Preheat oven to 375 F when ready to bake., Set 1 teaspoon of salsa into the dent that you made in the top of each bite., Bake at 375 F for 20-30 minutes, until the polenta is crispy and browned around the edges., Allow to cool slightly before serving.
target: Vegetable Broth, Chili Powder, Cornmeal, Salsa

input: 1., Beat Large eggs, butter, sugar and vanilla, 2., Add in dry ingredients., -HOW To create THE BISCOTTI- a., Roll dough out into a big snake - form into about three rolls b. Pat down ( you may brush on lowfat milk), 3., Bake about 20 min at 350 F., 4., Slice into diagonal cookies; place on sides and bake at 200 F. to brown (10 min), NOTES : This gal is very Italian!, A wonderful woman and a teacher to-boot!
target: eggs, Butter, Sugar, Vanilla, Flour Salt, Baking pwdr Nuts, Anise seed

input: Melt butter., Blend in flour, salt and pepper., Gradually add broth and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens., Pour gravy over noodles, chicken, peas and eggs in 2 quart casserole., Sprinkle with bread crumbs., Bake at 375° for 30 minutes.
target: butter, salt, chicken, chicken broth, noodles, peas, eggs, buttered bread crumbs, flour, pepper

input: 1.Pour olive oil into a large skillet and place over med. heat. Using your hands, squeeze squeeze tomatoes to crush them and add them into the olive oil along with the remaining ingredients. Cook over med.-low heat breaking up tomatoes with spoon until sauce is thick. About 40-50 minutes. 2.Pass sauce through food mill fitted with a medium disk, discard seeds and let cool.
target: olive oil, whole italian, oregano, salt, ground pepper

input: In a large skillet, saute onion in butter until tender. Add water and dill; bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 4-5 minutes. Add milk; stir in lemons and pepper. Top with fillets. Cover and simmer for 12-15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork., Transfer fish to a serving platter and keep warm. Strain cooking liquid, reserving lemons, onion and dill; serve with fish.
target: onion, butter, water, dill, milk, lemons, pepper, walleye

input: Mix all together., (If you like onion, add a few slices of onion in the blender for flavor.), Fry and enjoy with sugar, syrup or fresh strawberry jam.
target: eggs, milk, flour, salt

input: Combine 3 cups rye whiskey, 1/3 cup simple syrup, 1 tablespoon absinthe, 1 1/2 teaspoons Angostura bitters, and 3/4 cup ice water in a large pitcher; chill until very cold, at least 2 hours and up to 1 day. Divide among chilled rocks glasses and garnish each with a lemon twist.
target: rye whiskey, simple syrup, absinthe, bitters, lemon twists

input: Beat egg whites until stiff and set aside., Combine egg yolks, milk, melted butter and vanilla., Mix together flour, baking powder, salt and sugar and stir into batter., Fold in beaten egg whites., Fold in pecans., Bake on waffle iron according to manufacturers directions., Be sure waffles are completely browned before removing them.
target: eggs, milk, butter, vanilla, flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, pecans

input: Mix all ingredients., Drop by teaspoon on cookie sheet and bake at 375° for about 14 minutes., These cookies are very moist and good.
target: pumpkin, baking soda, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, flour, sugar, eggs, milk, vegetable oil, vanilla, chocolate chips, nuts

input: Brush the scallops with oil and season with salt and pepper., Grill over medium heat from elderberry wood for 3 minutes on each side., (Pecan, peach or apple wood may be substituted for elderberry wood), While peppers, onion and garlic are still warm, place them with the butter, mustard, honey and basil in a blender and process until smooth., Season to taste., Toss peas and apples in peanut oil and place on medium grill for about 3 minutes., Remove from grill., Place peas, apples and yellow pepper around a plate., Place scallops over them and pour sauce over the scallops., Garnish the dish with large black se
target: Olive oil, Salt, red peppers, onion, garlic, butter, mustard, honey, basil, Salt, sugar snap peas, apples, peanut oil, yellow pepper, Black sesame seeds

input: Prepare a hot grill., In a small bowl, combine soy sauce, vermouth, sugar, ginger and garlic., Set aside., Brush salmon with oil and place on an oiled grill., Grill, brushing the fish several times with the marinade, until lightly browned., Turn fish over gently and repeat., About 5 minutes per side.
target: soy sauce, sugar, fresh ginger, garlic, salmon, vegetable oil

input: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cook the pasta according to the package directions., When done, drain and run under cold water to cool., Lay the manicotti out on a clean tea towel., Spray a 9 x 13 inch glass baking dish with vegetable spray, and spread 1/3 of the marinara sauce in the bottom of the baking dish., In a large bowl, combine the ricotta, spinach, basil, mushrooms, Parmesan, and salt and pepper to taste., Use a teaspoon to gently fill the manicotti noodles with the filling, adding it a teaspoon full at a time., Each manicotti took about 4-5 teaspoons of filling., Cover the manicotti with the remaining 2/3 of marinara sauce., Sprinkle the shells with the mozzarella and bake until heated through, about 20 minutes., Increase heat to a low broil., Broil the manicotti until cheese begins to brown, 2 to 5 minutes., Serve with the salad and bread., Enjoy!
target: Ricotta Cheese, Fresh Basil, weight Mushrooms, Parmesan Cheese, Salt, Freshly Ground Black Pepper, Mozzarella Cheese

input: Pour boiling water over jello., Let cool and add remaining ingredients., Chill until firm.
target: lemon jello, boiling water, cottage cheese, mayonnaise, onion, celery

input: Line an 8-in. square pan with foil and lightly grease the foil with 2 teaspoons butter; set aside., In a small saucepan, combine gelatin and water. Cook and stir over medium-low heat until gelatin is dissolved. Add sugar and corn syrup; cook and stir until sugar is dissolved (do not boil)., Transfer to a large bowl. Chill until slightly thickened, about 30 minutes. Beat on high speed until mixture is thick and the volume is doubled, about 10 minutes. Spread into prepared pan. Cover and refrigerate for 6 hours or overnight., Using foil, lift marshmallows out of pan. Cut into 1-1/4-in. squares or cut into shapes with cutters lightly coated with cooking spray. Roll in garnishes as desired. Store in an airtight container in a cool, dry place.
target: butter, strawberry gelatin, water, sugar, light corn syrup, sprinkles, nonpareils

input: In skillet, combine sugar, cinnamon and milk., Cook to 236° (soft ball stage)., Stir in walnuts or pecan halves and vanilla extract., Immediately turn out on wax paper and separate nuts (working quickly)., Makes 3 1/2 cups.
target: sugar, cinnamon, milk, walnuts, vanilla

input: Boil the first 3 ingredients for 5 minutes., Dissolve jello in hot water and add to mixture., Add Marshmallow Creme and let chill thoroughly., Add cheese and nuts (can be left out)., Whip Dream Whip into milk., Fold into ingredients and chill., Serves 15 to 20 people.
target: pineapple, lemon juice, sugar, lime jello, water, Marshmallow Creme, grated cheese, nuts, Dream Whip, milk

input: Place all the ingredients in a blender and pulse 5 - 10 times for 3 seconds each., Serve in a chilled glass and enjoy - slowly!
target: milk, nutella, vanilla, crushed ice

input: Combine cooled black-eyed peas, rice and chicken., Add remaining ingredients; blend well and pack into an oiled 5 1/2 cup mold., Refrigerate until set., Unmold and spread with Avocado Topping., (Don't like molds?, Just use a casserole dish.)
target: black-eyed peas, rice, chicken, celery, onion, mayonnaise, salt, pepper, hot sauce

input: Mix and pour into baked crust., Bake 35 minutes., Serve with ice cream or whipped cream.
target: flour, oleo, powdered sugar, eggs, sugar, flour, baking powder, salt, nuts, vanilla, rhubarb

input: Combine all ingredients., except the sesame seeds., Cover and refrigerate mixture for 15 to 20 minutes., Add sesame seeds., (If desired)., mix well., Serve over salad.
target: vegetable oil, white wine vinegar, sesame oil, lemon juice, pepper, sugar, garlic, sesame seeds

input: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)., Grease and flour the loaf pan Mash bananas and add flour, sugar, butter, vanilla, baking powder, baking soda and egg., Mix well., Pour into loaf pan., Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 50 to 60 minutes, or until toothpick inserted into center of cake comes out clean.
target: flour, white sugar, butter, vanilla, baking soda, baking powder, egg, very ripe bananas

input: Toss almonds with sugar in nonstick frying pan; cook on medium heat 6 to 8 min., or until sugar forms a golden brown syrup and evenly coats the almonds, stirring constantly., Spread into single layer on greased baking sheet or sheet of wax paper; cool., Break into small pieces., Toss spinach leaves, Boston lettuce and halved strawberries in large bowl., Drizzle with Kraft Signature Creamy Poppyseed Dressing just before serving; mix lightly., Sprinkle with almonds., Serve on chilled plates.
target: almonds, sugar, fresh spinach leaves, Boston lettuce

input: Blend first 8 ingredients., Cook the Rotini (about 1/2 a package) and slice the peppers., Mix the last 6 ingredients together in a large bowl., Pour the dressing over top.
target: olive oil, vinegar, basil, green onions, parmesan cheese, salt, black pepper, oregano, rotini pasta, red pepper, green pepper, yellow pepper, feta cheese, black olives

input: Combine all ingredients into large mixing bowl; stir until mixed thoroughly., Grease a Pyrex dish, 13 x 9-inch., Pour mixture into greased Pyrex dish; pat into dish., Chill until firm. Sprinkle top with brown sugar or top with icing or chocolate Cool Whip., Cut into desired amounts.
target: peanut butter, oleo, graham cracker crumbs, vanilla, confectioners sugar

input: In a skillet, saute onion, celery and green pepper., Add broth, tomato sauce, salt and pepper., Place pickling spice in a small piece of cheesecloth and tie closed., Add to sauce and simmer for 45 minutes., In a separate skillet, flour and brown fish., Remove the pickling spice; add the fish., Simmer for 10 minutes., Serve over rice., Serves 6.
target: perch, butter, flour, onion, celery, green pepper, beef broth, tomato sauce, pickling spice, salt, pepper, rice

input: Mix ingredients and sprinkle with paprika., Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 30 minutes., Serve with crackers.
target: hearts, Parmesan cheese, mayonnaise, garlic powder

input: Line a baking pan with parchment paper. Spray the paper lightly with oil. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees, Mix the egg whites, flavorings and sugar in a bowl, Add the almonds and mix. Make sure to coat the nuts entirely with the egg mixture - this is what ensures that the cookie holds together, Drop by the heaping tablespoonful onto the lined baking sheet. Flatten so that there is almost a single layer of nuts, Bake for 12-14 minutes, the cookies must be browned a bit on the bottom or they will not cool/crisp properly, Slide the baked cookies onto a cooling rack. They are fragile, be careful! Cool completely. They can be stored in a covered container in the fridge for up to 4-5 days.
target: egg whites, confectioners sugar, orange zest, lemon, almonds

input: Cook over medium heat until it leaves sides of pan., Knead with hands until smooth., Store in airtight container., Will keep for months.
target: flour, salt, water, cream of tartar, oil, food coloring

input: Brown beef and onion in skillet., Add broth, soy sauce and sugar., Add vegetables., Bring to a full boil, separating vegetables with a fork and stirring frequently, until sauce cubes are blended., Cover and simmer 2 minutes., Bring again to a boil. Stir in rice., Cover, remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes.
target: ground beef, onion, beef broth, soy sauce, sugar, Chinese style vegetables, rice

input: Make sauce - puree lowfat sour cream, parsley, horseradish, lemon juice, and salt in food processor., Transfer to bowl., Mix in whipped cream., Refrigerateup to 4 hrs., Remove beef from frig 1 hr., before roasting., Preheat oven to 450 ., Place beef in foil lined pan., Combine oil and salt; brush over beef., Rub all over with crushed pepper., Roast 35 to 40 mins., till meat thermometer reaches 130 for med-rare., Let stand 15 minutes., or possibly up to 2 hours., before slicing., Slice beef and arrange on platter., Serve hot or possibly at room temp with Horseradish Sauce.
target: sour cream, Parsley, horseradish, Lemon juice, Salt, Heavy cream, beef tenderloin, Extra virgin olive oil, Salt, black pepper

input: Soak beans overnight; drain., Add cold water., Cook 1/2 hour; drain pot., In baking dish, add ingredients., Cover with boiling water., Bake 4 hours.
target: soup beans, bacon, syrup, baking soda, sugar, salt

input: Combine all ingredients together well., Add 2 tbsp to mug of boiling water.
target: chocolate powder, Coffee, instant coffee, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg

input: Char peppers directly over gas flame or under broiler until blackened on all sides., Enclose in paper bag; let stand 10 minutes., Peel, seed, and slice peppers thinly., Combine basil leaves, garlic, and salt in processor and blend to coarse puree., With machine running, gradually blend in oil., Transfer basil oil to small bowl., (Peppers and basil oil can be made 1 day ahead., Cover separately and chill.), Arrange ingredients on a large platter or in a large, shallow bowl, i., e., , prosciutto around outside, cheese slices within circle of prosciutto and tomatoes within circle of cheese, top with pepper strips (or however you think it will look better)., Sprinkle salad with olives; drizzle with some basil oil., Serve with remaining basil oil at table.
target: red bell peppers, basil leaf, clove garlic, salt, extra virgin olive oil, water, tomatoes, kalamata olives

input: Mix together and store in a shaker., I use a small zip-loc bag., Shake or rub 1 tbsp (15 ml) seasoning onto meat before cooking, regardless of method of cooking.
target: salt, black pepper, onion, garlic, red pepper, thyme, rosemary, fennel

input: Spread cream cheese onto bottom of microwaveable small dish or 9 inch pie plate., Sprinkle with cheddar cheese, ham and parmesan cheese., Microwave on high 1 minute or until heated through., Spread the top with bell peppers, onions and ground pepper, sprinkling each topping in a row over 1/3 of spread., Serve with crackers., *substitutes* You can also use chopped roasted red peppers, sliced jalapeno peppers or salsa in place of red bell peppers*.
target: cheddar cheese, parmesan cheese, cream cheese, red bell peppers, green onions, ground cayenne pepper, ham, crackers

input: In skillet, brown sausage and drain., In same skillet, add cream cheese to sausage., Heat until melted., Clean and remove stems from mushrooms., Stuff mushrooms heaping full with sausage mixture., Bake at 350° for 15 minutes or until lightly browned.
target: sausage, cream cheese, fresh mushrooms

input: Clean and cut corn into a large bowl and put to side., In large iron skillet, brown bacon., Remove from skillet and put to the side., Put corn in skillet; salt and pepper to taste in oil from bacon., Let cook for about 15 minutes, covered., Remove lid; add 3 tablespoons flour in 1 cup of water., Mix well and pour into corn., Stir often., Cook 10 minutes., Add sugar to taste and butter.
target: corn, bacon, salt, flour, sugar

input: Spread bread with cream cheese spread., Top 1 of the bread slices with bananas in three rows of three slices each., Sprinkle remaining bread slice with raisins; press gently into cream cheese to secure., Close sandwich to serve.
target: whole wheat bread, PHILADELPHIA, banana, raisins

input: Preheat oven to 350., Poach chicken until cooked thru, take out of water and cool., In a 13 X 9 in casserole, mix the soup and sour cream., Drain veggies and mix into soup mixture., Cube chicken and add to veggies., Cook stuffing according to the box., Put the stuffing on top of the mixture., Put in preheated oven for 20-25 minutes until it is hot thru out.
target: Stove Top stuffing mix, chicken, potatoes, green beans, corn, lima beans, cream of chicken soup, sour cream

input: Mix and bake, at 350° for twenty minutes or until edges start to brown., Serve with crackers or chips.
target: artichoke hearts, mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese, onion, garlic salt

input: Cook linguine in large pot of boiling salted water until tender but still firm to bite, stirring occasionally. Drain, reserving 1 cup pasta cooking liquid., Meanwhile, cook bacon in heavy large pot over medium heat until beginning to crisp, about 10 minutes. Transfer to paper towels to drain. Drain all but 2 tablespoons bacon drippings from skillet. Add onion and saut over medium-high heat until softened, about 7 minutes. Add Swiss chard and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add pasta cooking liquid to skillet. Toss until chard is wilted and tender, about 4 minutes. Sprinkle vinegar over; cook 1 minute., Add linguine and oil to sauce in pot and toss to coat. Transfer to large bowl. Sprinkle with bacon and cheese. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
target: linguine, bacon, red onion, Swiss chard, balsamic vinegar, extra-virgin olive oil, Parmesan cheese

input: Mix all together and cook as you would regular corn bread.
target: eggs, milk, meal, pepper, onion, grated cheese, sugar, cream-style

input: Put Vegeburger in oil in large skillet., Add next 6 ingredients and 1/2 cup water., Bring to boil and simmer 10 minutes., Add to 1 to 2 cups water to cover burger; bring to boil and add noodles., Stir; cover and simmer 15 to 20 minutes or until noodles are very tender., Add more water if necessary., Makes 4 to 6 servings.
target: Vegeburger, vegetable oil, tomatoes, tomato sauce, salt, sugar, garlic salt, grape juice, noodles

input: Boil last 6 ingredients, mixing well., Pour boiled mixture over shredded cabbage, onion and green pepper., Let cool. Refrigerate overnight.
target: cabbage, onion, green pepper, sugar, tarragon vinegar, dry mustard, celery, alt, vegetable oil

input: In a large stockpot, bring 10 gallons of water to a full boil., Add seasonings and bring water back to a full boil., Add crawfish, and bring back to a full boil., Once crawfish return to full boil, turn off fire, and add 1 gallon of the chilled After Boil Ingredients., Soak for 35 minutes, and then they are ready to eat., In a large pot, combine 1 gallon water with garlic, onions, celery, and lemons., Bring to a full boil for 15 minutes., Remove from heat and chill.
target: cayenne pepper, ground crab boil, salt, sack crawfish, gallon, gallon water, garlic, onions, celery, lemons

input: Cook pasta according to package., Mix up all ingredients and refrigerate., Serve cold., Feeds about 8 people.
target: salad pasta, red apple, eggs, stalks celery, turkey meat, mayonnaise, salt

input: Combine., Place in custard cups in water., Bake 45 minutes at 325°, or until knife comes out clean., Makes 6 to 8 individual cups.
target: eggs, sugar, vanilla, water, milk

input: Mix all of the above ingredients together.
target: rotini noodles, oil, cucumber, red onion, tomato, bell pepper

input: Combine the above ingredients., Bake, at 300 degrees, in a covered casserole for about 1-1/2 hours, until almost all of the liquid is absorbed. Spoon it into a shell, or serve it as a side.
target: chicken, taco, brown lentils, brown rice, onion

input: Preheat oven to 350F., Grease 2, 9-inch round cake pans; dust pans with flour., Cream butter and sugar together in large bowl., Add in Large eggs; beat till light and fluffy., Beat in vanilla and chocolate., Sift flour, baking soda, and salt together into separate bowl., Alternately add in flour mix and lowfat sour cream to butter mix; beat well after each addition., Stir in boiling water; batter will be thin., Pour batter into prepared pans; bake for 35 min., Cold in pans on wire rack for 10 min, then turn out onto rack; cold completely before frosting as desired.
target: Butter, Sugar, eggs, Vanilla, baking chocolate, cake flour, Baking soda, Salt, sour cream, Boiling water

input: Combine sugar, corn syrup, butter and salt., Bring to a boil over low heat., Pour hot syrup slowly over beaten eggs., Cool; add vanilla and pecans and pour into pie shell., Bake at 400° for 10 minutes., Reduce temperature to 375° and bake 35 to 40 minutes longer.
target: sugar, corn syrup, butter, salt, eggs, vanilla, pecans, shell

input: Heat oven to 350°F Butter 8-inch baking dish or casserole; set aside., In large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Add honey, egg and sour cream, and stir well. Stir in rhubarb., Pour batter into prepared dish., In small bowl, mix together turbinado sugar, cinnamon and butter. Sprinkle over batter in pan, filling in any bare spots with additional turbinado sugar., Bake for 35 minutes, or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool completely and serve with cream or ice cream. Yields 6 servings.
target: flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, honey, egg, sour cream, rhubarb, Topping, turbinado sugar, cinnamon, butter

input: Mix all ingredients well., Bake at 350° for 25 minutes.
target: flour, sugar, baking soda, salt, cocoa, vegetable oil, vinegar, vanilla, water

input: Combine all ingredients and mix well., Refrigerate for 1 hour.
target: Cheese, White Wine Vinegar, Buttermilk, Sugar, Sour Cream, Garlic, Mayonnaise, Salt

input: Put soda in milk., Mix all ingredients., Drop by teaspoon on large cookie sheet., Bake at 375°.
target: pumpkin, eggs, sugar, oil, brown sugar, baking powder, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, soda, milk, nuts, chocolate chips

input: Stir together all ingredients. Store in an airtight container up to 1 month.
target: brown sugar, garlic salt, chili powder, salt, ground black pepper, celery salt, ground white pepper, ground red pepper, ground cinnamon

input: Process first amount of watermelon in food processor or blender until smooth., Pour into 2 quart (2 L) pitcher., Add rum, liqeuer and second amount of watermelon., Stir., Cover., Chill., Just before serving, stir soft drink into watermelon mixture.
target: seedless watermelon, white rum, melon liqueur, seedless watermelon

input: With a hand mixer or stand mixer beat the two sugars and butter in a large bowl. Beat until light and fluffy. Add molasses, egg and vanilla extract until completely mixed in., In a separate bowl, mix the flour, baking soda, sea salt and spices. Add the flour mixture to the butter mixture until well incorporated. Cover and chill the gingersnap batter in the fridge for at least 30 minutes., Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or spray with nonstick cooking spray., Place the granulated sugar in a bowl. Scoop out a tablespoon of gingersnap dough and roll into a ball. Place in the bowl of granulated sugar and roll it around so it's entirely covered in sugar. Place on a baking sheet. Using the bottom of a glass cup, flatten the dough ball into a disc. Repeat until the baking sheet is full., Bake for 12 to 15 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. Enjoy with cold milk, hot tea or coffee! Gingersnap nirvana!
target: Brown Sugar, Sugar, Butter, ¼, Egg, Vanilla, All-purpose, Baking Soda, ¼, Ground Cinnamon, Ground Ginger, Ground Cloves, Sugar

input: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9 inch springform pan. Combine 1 1/2 tablespoons brown sugar, 1 1/2 tablespoons white sugar, and 1 teaspoon cinnamon in a small bowl; reserve., Whisk together flour, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, and baking powder in a large bowl. Use an electric mixer to beat the butter and 1 1/4 cups white sugar together in a separate large bowl. Beat until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time. Mix in 1/3 of the flour mixture until just combined. Beat in 1/2 of the milk and another 1/3 of the flour mixture. Repeat with the remaining milk and flour. Stir in the almond extract., Gently fold pears, blueberries, and chopped almonds into the batter. Pour into prepared pan. Sprinkle reserved sugar and cinnamon mixture over the cake batter., Bake in preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean, 40 to 50 minutes.
target: brown sugar, white sugar, cinnamon, flour, cinnamon, baking powder, unsalted butter, white sugar, eggs, milk, almond, blueberries, almonds

input: Rinse the chicken thigh well, remove any red sections (blood, sinews, etc., ), then wipe away excess water., Salt and pepper both sides., Add bay leaf and minced garlic into a thickly-bottomed pot., Add water and simmer the chicken patiently until it falls apart (about 30 minutes) and remove any scum., (Cooking time can vary depending on the pot.), When you can remove the bones without difficulty, shred the meat apart., Add ingredients and simmer for 5 to 10 minutes to finish!, Chop vegetables of your choice into bite-sizes., Grill or steam to dish up with the shredded chicken., Pour in lots of soup and serve!, Dip a spoonful of rice into the soup and enjoy!, It's a delicious, refreshing way to eat up a bunch of veggies.
target: Salt, Bay leaf, clove Garlic, Water, cubes, Curry, Mirin, Sake, Soy sauce, Carrot

input: Mix all ingredients until well blended., Let stand several hours to blend flavors.
target: mayonnaise, sour cream, pepper, oil, vinegar, garlic salt, onion salt, salt

input: Combine strawberries and peaches with their syrups in blender until smooth., Add remaining ingredients and beat about 1 to 2 seconds.
target: strawberries, peaches, milk, vanilla

input: Scrub sweet potatoes. Dry & rub with vegetable oil. Place in shallow baking pan & bake covered 30 min @350 degrees. Allow to cool peel and cut into 3/4 in slices. In saucepan melt 4 T butter over low heat. Add remaining ingredients & mix. Remove from heat. Butter a 3-4 Qt cassarole dish and add sweet potatoes in 3 layers. Pourig 1/3 of sauce over each layer. Bake covered 30 min @350 degrees. Remove from oven & mix w/wood spoon to breakup. Smooth top dot w/butter. Bake 350 degrees 20 min uncovered.
target: sweet potatoes, vegetable oil, Curacao, T, Bourbon, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, salt, pepper

input: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 13-by-9-inch casserole dish; lightly coat one side of a large piece of foil with butter. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, warm oil. Add sausage and cook, stirring and breaking up into small pieces with a wooden spoon, until no longer pink, about 8 minutes. Use a slotted spoon to remove sausage to a large bowl; reserve fat in skillet., Add onion and celery to skillet and cook 5 minutes, stirring. Add garlic, apples, sage and parsley and cook 5 minutes longer, stirring often. Remove from heat and add mixture to sausage., Add bread cubes to sausage mixture, toss until well combined. Season with salt and pepper and toss again. Gently stir in chicken broth, then egg. Spoon mixture into casserole dish, cover with buttered foil and bake for 40 minutes. Remove foil and bake about 20 minutes longer, until stuffing is crisp and golden on top. Serve warm.
target: unsalted butter, extra-virgin olive oil, Italian sausage, onion, celery, garlic, firm apples, fresh sage, parsley, bread, Salt, chicken broth, egg

input: Work flour and Crisco together until crumbly., Add other ingredients., Work dough until it forms a ball and leaves bowl clean., Wrap in wax paper and refrigerate overnight or for about 6 hours.
target: flour, Crisco, egg yolks, sweet cream, yeast, salt

input: Beat flour into potato (I used electric handwhisk)., beat in egg., gradually beat in milk., season quite heavily., In my machine I used just under a cup of the batter and vaguely spread across the preheated plate before closing and cooking at quite a high heat for about 4 minutes., Keep warm while you cook the remainder.
target: potatoes, flour, milk, egg, salt, pepper

input: In a large saucepan, combine lemon zest and juice, orange zest and juice, red wine, sugar, cinnamon sticks and 1 1/4 cups water. Heat gently, stirring, until sugar dissolves. Add pears and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 40-50 mins, until pears are tender. Transfer pears to a serving dish., Bring syrup to a boil and cook for 5 mins, until reduced slightly. Pour over pears and let cool. Serve warm or cold.
target: lemon, orange, red wine, sugar, cinnamon sticks, firm pears

input: Beat eggs; add chiles and cheese., Cook in skillet., Top with XLNT, Hormel, Stagg or your own homemade chili.
target: eggs, Ortaga, cheese

input: For the dressing, combine/whisk garlic, Dijon mustard and balsamic vinegar in a small bowl to combine., Using a small whisk gradually add in the oil, beating until well blended., Add in the Italian seasoning, salt and pepper., In a large bowl, combine lettuce, turkey, proscuitto, cubed cheese, garbonzo beans, cherry tomato halves, olives and sliced onions., Pour enough dressing over as desired; toss to combine., Season salad with salt and pepper to taste., Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese if desired and serve.
target: fresh garlic, mustard, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, dryed italian seasoning, salt, head lettuce, turkey, ham, swiss cheese, garbanzo beans, tomatoes, olives, parmesan cheese, red onion, salt

input: In saucepan, heat achiotina on medium low, stir in scallions and cook until soft - about three minutes. Stir in potatoes and cook for three minutes. Add the adobo, water and seasonings and bring to a boil on medium high. Reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are completely done - about 30 minutes., With a wooden spoon, mash sever potato cubes against the side of the pan to thicken soup. Add milk and corn and return to boil. Simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in cheese and heavy cream. Heat until cheese melts and soup thickens., Serve hot. Garnish with cubed ripe avocado, chopped boiled eggs and additional scallions, if desired.
target: scallions, potatoes, water, cilantro, powdered chipotle chiles, milk, corn, feta cheese, heavy cream

input: Preheat oven to 350° (325° for glass pan)., Mix dry and wet ingredients separately and then together., Pour into a small (8 x 8-inch or 9 x 9-inch) pan., Bake at 350° (325° for glass pan) for 30 to 35 minutes., Recipe can be doubled (9 x 13-inch pan); add 10 minutes or so to baking time.
target: flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt

input: Mix flour with baking soda., Combine butter, sugars, vanilla and pudding; beat until smooth., Beat in eggs., Add flour mixture. Stir in chips and nuts., Bake in 375° oven for 8 to 10 minutes.
target: flour, baking soda, butter, white sugar, brown sugar, vanilla, instant vanilla pudding, eggs, chocolate chips, nuts

input: Mix and let set out overnight to sour., Refrigerate for 5 days., Feed to make bread.
target: yeast, water, sugar

input: fry bolonga until lightly browned, and egg breaking yolk in the butter put cheese on egg after you have flipped it, put mayo on one side bread, add lettuce, cut on diagonal.
target: egg, butter, bologna, American cheese, mayonnaise, leaf lettuce, bread

input: Combine the yogurt, paprika, ginger, garlic, curry powder, cinnamon, and saffron in a zip-top plastic bag. Zip closed and squish with your hands to mix the ingredients inside the bag. Open and add chicken., Refrigerate. turning the back occasionally, at least 8 hours or overnight. This is the point where I put this in the freezer., Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place a rack inside a roasting pan. Spray the rack with non-stick spray. Remove the chicken from the marinade and discard marinade. Transfer chicken to the pan rack and sprinkle with salt and pepper., Roast chicken until cooked through, 22 - 25 minutes., According to WW book: 1 thigh has 169 calories, 9 g fat, 2 g sat fat, 0 g trans fat, 75 mg cholesterol, 364 mg sodium, 1 g carbs, 0 g fiber, 12 g protein, 21 mg of calcium. Each thigh is 4 pts.
target: nonfat yogurt, paprika, ginger, garlic, curry powder, cinnamon, saffron thread, chicken, salt, pepper

input: Wash the potatoes well (you will also be eating the skins)., Cut the potatoes into wedges and place in a bowl., Pour in the olive oil and toss to coat (you can use other oil if you like)., Once the potatoes are coated in the oil, arrange on a baking sheet lined withparchment paper., Bake in an oven at 250C for 30 minutes, keeping an eye on them as they bake., The skins will become nice and crispy., Sprinkle with salt, pepper, and parsley and serve., New potatoes are delicious., So fluffy yet crispy., You can cut the potatoes into sticks., Chunks., They're great even without seasonings or with a bit of ketchup.
target: Olive oil, Salt

input: Mix together and last mix in the 4 beaten egg whites., Pour in uncooked pie crust., Bake slow at 325° for 1 hour; watch closely. Makes 2 small pies or 1 very large one.
target: eggs, vinegar, cinnamon, allspice, raisins, sugar, butter

input: Beat egg whites in clean, large bowl with mixer at high speed until foamy (use only grade A clean, uncracked eggs). Gradually add sugar and lemon extract. Beat at high speed until thickened. NOTE: When dry, Royal Icing is very hard and resistant to damage that can occur during shipping/handling.
target: egg whites, sugar, lemon

input: Cut beef across grain into 1/8 inch strips., Combine soy sauce, garlic, ginger and beef; toss., Heat oil in large frying pan or wok., Add beef and toss over high heat until brown., Taste and if not tender, reduce heat, cover and simmer 30 to 45 minutes., Turn heat up; add veggies., Toss about 10 minutes, until tender-crisp. Combine cornstarch and water., Add to pan., Stir and cook until thickened., Add tomatoes and toss to heat through., Serve over rice with chow mein noodles.
target: beef round steak, soy sauce, clove garlic, ground ginger, salad oil, green onion, red, celery, cornstarch, water, tomatoes

input: Boil together 1/2 cup of the milk and the chocolate., Let cool., Beat sugar and butter until creamy., Add the eggs, remaining milk (which has had the soda dissolved in it), lemon and vanilla extracts, the chocolate and flour., Bake in layers, using any desired filling., Bake at 350° until cake tests done.
target: chocolate, milk, sugar, butter, eggs, soda, lemon extract, vanilla extract, flour

input: In a large heavy saucepan, whisk eggs and sugar until blended; stir in milk. Cook over low heat until mixture is just thick enough to coat a metal spoon and a thermometer reads at least 160°, stirring constantly. Do not allow to boil. Remove from heat immediately., Quickly transfer to a large bowl; place bowl in a pan of ice water. Let sit for 2 minutes, occasionally stirring gently. Stir in cream, heavy cream and vanilla. Press plastic wrap onto surface of the custard. Refrigerate several hours or overnight., Fill cylinder of ice cream maker no more than two-thirds full; freeze according to manufacturer's directions. (Refrigerate any remaining mixture until ready to freeze.), Transfer ice cream to freezer containers, allowing headspace for expansion. Freeze until firm, at least 4 hours.
target: eggs, sugar, milk, cream, heavy whipping cream, vanilla

input: Combine all ingredients together in a 2 quart casserole., Cover and bake in 350 degree oven for 40-45 minutes. Fluff with fork.
target: long grain rice, chicken broth, butter, parsley flakes, salt, garlic

input: Fry pork chops until well done., Peel and slice potatoes. Place pork chops in bottom of small roaster or electric skillet. Cover with sliced potatoes., Spoon soup and spread evenly over potatoes., Add water and salt., Cook on high or bake in oven at 350° for 20 to 30 minutes until juices are bubbly and potatoes are done., Serves 6.
target: pork chops, potatoes, cream of mushroom soup, water, salt

input: Cook the rice according to package directions minus 1/4 cup water. Drain and cool., , Bring 2 cups water and 1/2 tablespoon salt to a boil in a medium saucepan and cook the shrimp for 1 minute. Drain immediately and set aside., , Heat the butter in saucepan and saute the pepper and onion until soft, about 5 minutes., , Preheat oven to 325 degrees F., , In a large bowl, combine the rice, soup, 1 1/2 cups of cheese, shrimp and vegetables. Add salt and pepper, to taste. Mix well. Place in 11 by 7-inch glass casserole dish with vegetable spray. Place the mixture in the pan and top with remaining 1/2 cup cheese. Bake for 30 minutes, until bubbly.
target: Shrimp, rice, shrimp, butter, green bell pepper, onion, condensed cream, Cheddar, Salt, rice according, water, butter, F.

input: Work all ingredients together and let the dough stand for 20 minutes, in a cool place., Put dough into a pastry bag or cloth and press/roll dough into long thin rolls., Cut rolls into equal sized pieces (about 5-6 inches long) and on a well-greased cookie sheet, form each piece into a small ring slightly overlapping the cut ends., Bake in a fairly hot (400°F, 200°C, GM 6) oven for 10 minutes or until light brown.
target: flour, baking powder, butter, sugar, blanched almonds, egg, vanilla

input: Lightly brown ground beef., Add remaining ingredients (chop onion); mix and cook over low heat until onion is done, stirring occasionally., Serve on hamburger buns.
target: ground beef, catsup, water, dry mustard, chili powder, vinegar, onion
